Could you please provide more details on what you were doing, and more
importantly which version you were using.

The issue here is more on bad error reporting than we just failing when we
shouldn't. The offending line (CachedManifest:69) is:

return getManifest().get(key);

Since getManifest() may return null if something bad happens while retrieving
the actual (non-cached) manifest, we should be preventing an NPE to happen.
Also, the bundle exception that happens while loading the non-cached manifest is
simply caught and forgotten. That is really bad... we have no idea why we failed.

Iam using version 3.0 of eclipse, I have downloaded this 
"3.0 Stream Stable Build 3.0M8 Fri, 26 Mar 2004 -- 15:17 (-0500)" from eclipse 
download site.

When I start eclipse for the 1st time it starts normally and after I exit and 
start again it asks for workspace and once I select it, The splash screen 
remains and the workbench dont come up.

I found the reported exception in .metadata/.log file

Please rename the the configuration directory inside eclipse install dir (for
instance, d:\eclipse\configuration) to something else
(<eclipse_home>\configuration.bak), and try running again.

Some questions:
- where is Eclipse installed?
- did you extract Eclipse zip file over an existing (previous) Eclipse install?
- how do you run Eclipse (any command line arguments)?

Thanks.

Some questions:
- where is Eclipse installed?
e:\eclipse 

- did you extract Eclipse zip file over an existing (previous) Eclipse install?
No i didnt.

- how do you run Eclipse (any command line arguments)?
double click eclipse.exe
Thanks for the answers. Did the workaround suggested in comment 4 worked for you?

Please provide the information requested above so we can try to diagnose the
problem. Thanks.

Nothing works The splash screen is still static I dont see the work bench 
coming up. Any way I reverted back to 2.1 eclipse Iam not using 3.0

I had run into a similar problem using eclipse v3M8.  I had closed my workbench 
because I was having CVS problems.  I then deleted my .log file and tried to 
restart the workbench.  Then I got an error about not being able to restore the 
workspace state.  Then nothing happened.  And then when I tried again to 
restart the workbench, I got the below error and could not restart the 
workbench.  Renaming the configuration folder, however, fixed the problem for 
me.

I released some code to do the proper logging when the problem happens. The NPE
will still be issued. This will be in for tomorrow's integration build.

Vamsi, if you could try i20040413 or later, that would be great. You will
probably get the same NPE during startup, but at least the reason the NPE
happens will be known, and we will be able to provide an workaround for you and
fix the bug before M9. Thanks.

We cannot reproduce.  More logging has been added so that if the problem crops 
up again, we can get more info.  Feel free to reopen if you find more data etc.
